body_html:
New Travis log, with Python 3.6:

$ pip install tensorflow
Collecting tensorflow
  Downloading tensorflow-1.5.0-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (44.4MB)
...
Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.12.1 in 
...
$ python -c "import numpy; print(numpy.version.full_version)"
1.13.3

So TensorFlow has set Numpy >= 1.12.1 as a dependency, which is the problem I guess, because it needs Numpy 1.14 here? I still have to try with a newer Numpy.

body:
[New Travis log](https://travis-ci.org/rwth-i6/returnn/jobs/335558010), with Python 3.6:

```
$ pip install tensorflow
Collecting tensorflow
  Downloading tensorflow-1.5.0-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (44.4MB)
...
Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.12.1 in 
...
$ python -c "import numpy; print(numpy.version.full_version)"
1.13.3
```

So TensorFlow has set Numpy >= 1.12.1 as a dependency, which is the problem I guess, because it needs Numpy 1.14 here? I still have to try with a newer Numpy.
